greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 1<=k<=C(n), read by rows: T(n,k) = number of elements <= k-th path in the poset of Dyck paths of semilength n ordered by inclusion.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..9, flattened
example: Dyck paths of semilength n=3 listed in lexicographic order:
maple: d:= proc(n, l) local m; m:= nops(l);
for i to nops(x) do if x[i]>y[i] then return false fi od; true
T:= proc(n) option remember; local l;
mathematica: d[n_, l_] := d[n, l] = Module[{m}, m = Length[l]; If[n == m, {l}, Flatten[#, 1]& @ Table[d[n, Append[l, j]], {j, If[m == 0, 1, Max[m+1, Last[l]]], n}]]]; le[x_, y_] := Module[{i}, For[i = 1, i <= Length[x], i++, If[x[[i]] > y[[i]], Return[False]]]; True]; T[n_] := T[n] = Module[{l}, l = d[n, {}]; Table[Sum[If[le[l[[i]], l[[j]]], 1, 0], {i, 1, j}], {j, 1, Length[l]}]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 6}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 01 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Lengths and last elements of rows give A000108.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 02 2011
